revised_title: Ariel 5 Satellite Observations of Binary X-ray Sources
tldr: The Ariel 5 satellite observed binary X-ray sources in the Milky Way, providing new data on their light curves and spectral properties. The observations revealed evidence of stellar wind-driven accretion in some sources and provided insights into the nature of these binary systems. The data also detected new sources not previously identified by other satellites, suggesting that many unidentified sources in the Milky Way may also be in close binary systems.
